node.title: Queensland's COVID test mandate for travellers questioned by federal Health Minister
node.alt: Composite image of Greg Hunt and Yvette D'Ath
node.description: Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt has written to Queensland's Health Minister Yvette D'Ath asking her to reconsider the state's demand that interstate travellers be tested for COVID before their journey, saying it is contrary to national recommendations.
node.content:
["Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt has written to his Queensland counterpart Yvette D'Ath\u00a0to \"raise concerns\" over the state's requirement for interstate travellers to have tested negative to COVID-19 before arrival.", "The testing requirement affects travellers moving in and out of Queensland after the state passes the 80 per cent double-vaccination of those over 16 milestone.", "Queensland has stood firm on the demand that all travellers from interstate hotspots must show they have returned a negative PCR test within the previous 72 hours, despite the $150 cost per test for anyone with no COVID symptoms.", "In recent days Queensland ministers have sought to pressure the federal government into helping to fund the tests for travellers.", "In a letter sent to the Queensland's Health Minister last night, Mr Hunt said he was concerned that\u00a0vaccinated domestic travellers arriving from a COVID-19 hotspot declared by the Queensland Chief Health Officer would be required to get the test.", "\"I note this declaration is a Queensland-only definition of a hotspot and has not been declared\u00a0by the Australian Government's Chief Medical Officer,\" he wrote.", "\"Under the National Plan, agreed to by all First Ministers, the Commonwealth's hotspot declaration automatically ceases within a particular state or territory two weeks after the 80 per cent fully vaccinated rate has been reached within that jurisdiction.", "\"I am concerned about this in two regards. Firstly, it appears Queensland has failed to give sufficient regard to the value of rapid antigen testing (RAT) in this context, and secondly, that Queensland is proposing not to assist Queenslanders with the provision of these tests.\"", "
Palaszczuk says Queensland 'in a unique situation'
", "Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said yesterday the policy was likely to stay \"until we get to that 90 per cent double dose\".", "\"They're also required in other states as well, it's not just Queensland,\" she said.", "\"We are in a unique situation here, we have had zero cases for many, many days now, we are getting our vaccination rates up.", "\"This is a measure that has been put in place and will remain in place on the advice of our Chief Health Officer.\"", "But Mr Hunt said he wanted\u00a0Queensland to reconsider its approach.", "\"The Australian Health Protection Principal Committee's (AHPPC) updated statement on asymptomatic testing states that large-scale, non-targeted, asymptomatic testing in Australia should be strongly discouraged,\" he wrote.", "\"Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic, the Australian Government has spent around $1.75 billion on [Medicare-funded] COVID-19 pathology testing.", "\"I would welcome reconsideration of Queensland approach to ensure that appropriate and risk proportionate COVID-19 testing arrangements support the resumption of domestic travel, in line with the National Plan to Transition Australia's National COVID-19 Response agreed by all governments at National Cabinet.\"", "The ABC has requested a response from Ms D'Ath."]
